title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON — On a night when offensive artistry was in short supply, one man reached into his personal bag of tricks and pulled out a performance for the ages. While the final score reads like a defensive slugfest, this was the Hakeem Olajuwon Show, a historic, virtuoso display by The Dream that single-handedly propelled the Houston Rockets to an 89-80 victory over the Dallas Mavericks.

The stat line defies belief: 42 points, 13 rebounds, 5 assists, 2 steals, and 2 blocks. In a grinding 80s-style contest where points were a premium, Olajuwon was an oasis of unstoppable offense. He operated with impunity from the low block, his signature "Dream Shake" leaving a trail of Mavericks defenders grasping at air. Every double-team was met with a savvy pass, and every Dallas rally was answered by another feathery jumper or powerful post move from the Rockets' center.

The rest of the game was a footnote to his dominance. Houston’s second-leading scorer, Clyde Drexler, managed just 13 points, while Dallas was led by a plucky 18-point effort from Michael Finley. But they were mere mortals sharing the floor with a basketball deity.

In an era defined by its giants, Olajuwon delivered a masterpiece. This was not merely a win; it was a declaration. On this night, through sheer force of will and sublime skill, Hakeem Olajuwon reminded the NBA why he remains one of the most unstoppable forces the game has ever seen.
